title: Spack create does not set version
body:
When running `spack create` on a URL, Spack correctly detects the version of the package:

```
$ spack create http://sourceforge.net/projects/pyqt/files/QScintilla2/QScintilla-2.9.1/QScintilla-gpl-2.9.1.tar.gz
==> This looks like a URL for QScintilla-gpl version 2.9.1
==> Creating template for package QScintilla-gpl
==> Warning: Got an error parsing HTML. Use Python 2.7.3 or newer for better HTML parsing.
  http://sourceforge.net/projects/pyqt/files/QScintilla2/QScintilla-2.9.1
  HTMLParseError: malformed start tag, at line 762, column 115
==> Downloading...
==> Trying to fetch from http://sourceforge.net/projects/pyqt/files/QScintilla2/QScintilla-2.9.1/QScintilla-gpl-2.9.1.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Created package /blues/gpfs/home/software/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/QScintilla-gpl/package.py
```

but sets the version to `version`:

``` python
version('version', '38e6248cb970adf6d05aea7d94f1288e')
```
